race.name: Kemonomimi
entries: Kemonomimi are humanoids with animal-like features such as ears, tails, wings, or horns. Their appearance varies widely depending on their subrace.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kemonomimi reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century, similar to humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Kemonomimi tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kemonomimi vary in height from just under 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Cat Burglar
entries: You are proficient in the Stealth skill.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Hunter
entries: You can cast the hunter's mark spell once per long rest.

entries.name: Naturally Graceful
entries: You have resistance to fall damage.

entries.name: Alpha Dog
entries: You know the guidance cantrip and can cast heroism once per long rest.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You are proficient in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Puppy Dog Eyes
entries: You are proficient in the Persuasion skill.

entries.name: Bird Wings
entries: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. You must move at least half your speed each turn or fall.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries: You are proficient in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Fox Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Foxy
entries: Once per long rest, you can grant yourself advantage on a Charisma-based skill check.

Kemonomimi are humanoids with animal traits, often ears and tails. Once divided by civil war, they now live in peace and integrate into other societies. They refer to others as 'Friends' in honor of the clan that ended their conflict.

entries.name: Names
entries: **Male:** Norio, Boris, Ritsuka, Kyou, Ikuto, Toby
**Female:** Eris, Kiriya, Holo, Himari, Ai, Hanekawa
